channel.title: Business Studies Coursework
channel.description:
Hai. Here art my question :
Question: How does a small independent retailer survive in the same market as the large supermarkets? What could have been done to improve the likelihood of survival?
Easy, simple. The following reasons i have so far : - They are generally closer to people's houses. - Shop loyalty, like if you keep going there they may give you lil bonuses - Quicker to go to if you want small, because usually the queues in supermarkets are massive. So, does anyone have any other ideas? The above are just...uh...boring..dull...original. Thanks :)

item.title: Business Studies Coursework
item.dc:creator: @infidelik infidelik
item.description:
@infidelik wrote:

Large supermarkets tend to employ huge numbers of people and as a result most of them don’t know much about the products they sell. A smaller shop will probably pride itself on its expert knowledge and so will be able to give you a lot more help and advice. Linking to this - if you take a broken item to a large chain store, they will try and sell you a whole new unit but in a small shop they would probably try and sell you something that will fix it at a fraction of the cost.
